{{Infobox football biography | name = Dimitri Foulquier | image = Dimitri Foulquier.jpg | image_size = 150 | fullname = Dimitri Foulquier{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/-/media/files/thefaportal/governance-docs/registrations/august-2017.ashx |title=List of players under written contract registered between 01/08/2017 and 31/08/2017 |publisher=The Football Association |format=PDF |page=5 |accessdate=17 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1993|3|23|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Sarcelles]], France | height = 1.84 m | position = [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|Right back]] | currentclub = [[Getafe CF|Getafe]]
(on loan from [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]) | clubnumber = 24 | youthyears1 = 2000–2001 | youthclubs1 = Capesterre Belle-Eau | youthyears2 = 2001–2007 | youthclubs2 = Marquisat Capesterre | youthyears3 = 2007–2011 | youthclubs3 = [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]] | years1 = 2011–2014 | clubs1 = [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]] | caps1 = 19 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2013–2017 | clubs2 = [[Granada CF|Granada]] | caps2 = 92 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2017– | clubs3 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | caps3 = 0 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2017–2018 | clubs4 = → [[RC Strasbourg]] (loan) | caps4 = 16 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2018– | clubs5 = → [[Getafe CF|Getafe]] (loan) | caps5 = 13 | goals5 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2010–2011 | nationalteam1 = [[France national under-18 football team|France U18]] | nationalcaps1 = 7 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2011–2012 | nationalteam2 = [[France national under-19 football team|France U19]] | nationalcaps2 = 10 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | nationalyears3 = 2012–2013 | nationalteam3 = [[France national under-20 football team|France U20]] | nationalcaps3 = 13 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2013–2014 | nationalteam4 = [[France national under-21 football team|France U21]] | nationalcaps4 = 13 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalyears5 = 2018– | nationalteam5 = [[Guadeloupe national football team|Guadeloupe]] | nationalcaps5 = 1 | nationalgoals5 = 0 | club-update = 13:27, 4 July 2018 (UTC) | ntupdate = 15 February 2019 }} '''Dimitri Foulquier''' (born 23 March 1993) is a [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]] for the Spanish club [[Getafe CF]] on loan from English club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]. Foulquier previously represented the [[France national under-21 football team]],{{cite news |title=Jeunes: Dimitri Foulquier récompensé |url=http://www.stade-rennais-online.com/+Jeunes-Dimitri-Foulquier+.html |work=[[Stade Rennais F.C.]] |date=19 April 2010 |accessdate=2 October 2011 | language = French}} before switching to represent the [[Guadeloupe national football team]]. == Club career == Born in [[Sarcelles]], Foulquier was raised in [[Capesterre-de-Marie-Galante|Capesterre]], a [[Communes of France|commune]] in the [[overseas region]] and [[Overseas department|department]] of [[Guadeloupe]].{{cite news |title=Dimitri Foulquier ne se "prend pas la tête" |url=http://www.stade-rennais-online.com/2164-Dimitri-Foulquier-ne-se-prend.html |work=[[Stade Rennais F.C.]] |date=24 April 2011 |accessdate=2 October 2011 | language = French}} === Rennes === After excelling with local clubs in the commune, he was spotted by [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]] scout [[Patrick Rampillon]] and, subsequently, joined the professional club in July 2007.{{cite news |title=Dimitri, graine de champion |url=http://www.viva.presse.fr/Dimitri-graine-de-champion_13918.html |work=Viva Presse |date=24 April 2011 |accessdate=2 October 2011 | language = French}} Foulquier was awarded the ''Best Academy Player'' award for the 2009–10 season. After appearing on the bench in matches during the [[2010–11 Ligue 1|2010–11 season]], he was promoted to the senior team by manager [[Frédéric Antonetti]] for the [[2011–12 Ligue 1|2011–12 season]]. Foulquier was assigned the number 24 shirt and made his professional debut on 2 October 2011 in a league match against [[Lille OSC|Lille]], starting but being replaced on the half-time in the eventual 0–2 away loss.{{cite web|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/74452|title=LOSC Lille – Stade Rennais FC|publisher=[[Ligue 1]]|date=2 October 2011|accessdate=13 August 2014}} === Granada === On 27 August 2013, Foulquier was loaned to [[La Liga]] side [[Granada CF|Granada]].{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2013/08/27/futbol/equipos/granada/1377614220.html|title=Foulquier llega cedido|trans-title=Foulquier arrives on loan|language=Spanish|publisher=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|date=27 August 2013|accessdate=13 August 2014}} He made his debut in the competition on 30 September, [[Substitute (association football)|replacing]] [[Michael Pereira]] in a 2–0 home win against [[Athletic Bilbao]].{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2013_14/primera/jornada_7/gda_ath/|title=El Arabi recupera la sonrisa del público granadino|trans-title=El Arabi recovers the smiles from the ''granadino'' attendance|language=Spanish|publisher=Marca|date=1 October 2013|accessdate=13 August 2014}} On 25 May 2014, the [[Andalusia]]ns bought Foulquier outright, for a €2 million fee, with the player signing a five-year deal.{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2014/05/25/futbol/equipos/granada/1401048374.html|title=El Granada ejerce la opción de compra sobre Foulquier|trans-title=Granada activates the buyout clause over Foulquier|language=Spanish|publisher=Marca|date=25 May 2014|accessdate=13 August 2014}} === Watford === Foulquier signed for [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on 25 August 2017,[http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/watfordfc/watfordfcnews/15496588.French_Under_21_Foulquier_joins_Hornets/ France Under-21 right-back Dimitri Foulquier joins Watford from Granada] but was immediately loaned out to [[Ligue 1]] side [[RC Strasbourg]] for the remainder of the 2017–18 Season.https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Watford-prete-dimitri-foulquier-a-strasbourg/828745 On 23 August 2018, Foulquier returned to Spain and its first division after agreeing to a one-year loan deal with [[Getafe CF]].{{cite web|url=https://www.watfordfc.com/teams/first-team/official-foulquier-joins-getafe|title=Official: Foulquier Joins Getafe|publisher=Watford FC|date=23 August 2018|access-date=23 August 2018}} == International career == Foulquier was a [[France national youth football team|France youth international]], having represented his country at [[France national under-18 football team|under-18]] through [[France national under-21 football team|under-21]] levels, including winning the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]], in which he scored in the [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]] in the final.{{cite web|title=France triumph after shootout drama|url=https://www.fifa.com/u20worldcup/matches/round=259225/match=300232810/match-report.html#nosticky|publisher=[[FIFA]]|accessdate=5 August 2015|date=13 July 2013}} Foulquier was called up to the [[Guadeloupe national football team]] for [[CONCACAF Nations League]] match against [[Curaçao national football team|Curaçao]] on 19 November 2018.{{cite web|url=http://www.guadeloupe.franceantilles.mobi/actualite/sports/football/beauvue-et-d-autres-pros-avec-les-gwada-boys-511787.php|title=Beauvue et d'autres pros avec les Gwada Boys - Toute l'actualité de la Guadeloupe en ligne - FranceAntilles.fr|website=www.guadeloupe.franceantilles.mobi}} He made his debut for the squad in that game, as a starter, which Guadeloupe lost with the score of 0–6.{{cite web|publisher=[[CONCACAF]]|url=https://www.concacafnationsleague.com/en/nations-league-qualifying/game-detail/440489#tab_match=match-details|title=Curaçao v Guadeloupe game report|date=19 November 2018}} == Career statistics == === Club === {{Updated|4 July 2018}}{{cite web|title=D. Foulquier|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/dimitri-foulquier/175301/|website=Soccerway|accessdate=14 January 2018}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !rowspan=2|Club
